scenarioDescription:
The eps Tau Exoplanetary System


Overview

eps Tau is a star with 2.7 times the mass of the Sun, and 13.7 times its radius. It is located 155.02 light years away from the solar system.

eps Tau is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the eps Tau system


eps Tau b

eps Tau b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory, in 2007-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.93 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of eps Tau b is 2416.800 times the mass of Earth. The radius of eps Tau b is 12.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, eps Tau b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system eps Tau, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
name: eps Tau - System With 1 Exoplanet
